text:
i can’t find anything about form submission events in the documentation, except that submitted form events are legacy and manually tracked behavioral events replaced them. i would think hooking onto a form submit would be more straightforward than setting up something with the API. we don’t want to track this in HubSpot. are we missing something?
```Do HubSpot forms fire events when completed?
I just want to scroll the page up since the screen jumps a lot when it puts the success message up there.```

Hey there, we using Smartling for our website translation and it appears that one of our page templates has missing key values in the JSON output. Does anyone have any recommendations for troubleshooting? Thanks for your help :)

Hello Everyone,
I have created an App with the required scopes and Auth. Now using that App I want to create and Manage Marketing Events and Its Subscriber State (Contact Association).

I am confused with the parameters that need to be passed while creating a Marketing Event.
Can Anyone Help me Please?
<@U2H3TT8F2>
#MarketingEvents

Hi <@U022D234JFM> have you reviewed the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/marketing-events|documentation>? If not, please do so as that should answer most of you questions. If you have, could you be more specific about what parameters are confusing?

I think what you’re looking for are <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/global-form-events|global form events > you should be able to hook into thos to see hwhen a form is submitted and handle scrolling from there
Don’t worry about that being documented on legacy docs, they’re just older, not going anywhere
LOL in my world, “legacy” means “pretend this never happened, unless someone asks who did it,”

So, this is fun… Seems like Zapier’s Formatter for ISO 8601 timestamps will only output full UTC offsets (“-0000” or “-00:00", which might not even be valid ISO 8601 according to Wikipedia, since it’s not “+00:00”). Meanwhile, HubSpot API’s ISO 8601 support for `datetime` only supports zero-offset Z, not full offsets. Oh, and Zapier seems to be truncating the milliseconds off epoch timestamps. Had to resort to a Custom Request webhook to pipe a Meeting Start Time from Chili Piper to HubSpot.

Why the partial ISO 8601 support?
